intro: Coccoloba ovata, commonly known as the broadleaf spinach or prickly pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in small, sharp spines. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in shades of red, pink, or white. Coccoloba ovata is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
